title: POC Spike (Minimum Agent Loop)
summary: Proves the Codexa core by wiring the minimum agent chain (PM→Designer→Implementer→Tester) with logging, approvals and demo collateral.
rationale: Validates orchestration and audit hand-offs end-to-end before expanding scope.

context.scope_guidance: Enable a human to run, observe and judge the agent loop.
context.readiness_note: Streams marked CHANGE IMPACTED or PARTIAL must rerun before acceptance.

title: Discovery MVP
summary: Delivers a runnable discovery pipeline producing manifests, System Model Graph projections, understanding metrics and seeded change journeys.
rationale: Establishes Codexa’s automated discovery loop and governance data flow.

context.scope_guidance: Prioritise quick/deep discovery modes and first loop-plan/seed workflow.
context.readiness_note: Demo readiness once discovery runs populate manifests and human scope selection works.

title: Operating Model Integration
summary: Operationalises the CR004 operating model so every Codexa deployment resolves configuration lineage through .codexa/ scaffolding and inherits global defaults.
rationale: Unifies configuration and provenance handling across deployments with linting, control-plane bundle and telemetry validation.

context.scope_guidance: Deliver FR-42–FR-44 and related FR-01/02/06/32/38/39 updates; advanced registries out of scope.
context.readiness_note: Requires .codexa/ linting in CI, published defaults with hashes, successful config doctor tests and audit lineage records.

title: Foundation
summary: Core repository scaffolding, audit, and interaction primitives that underpin all milestones.
rationale: Provides the structural and logging backbone required for agent orchestration.

title: Interaction
summary: Human ↔ AI command surface, approval flows, and audit command routing.
rationale: Ensures every milestone remains observable and controllable by humans.

title: Governance
summary: Change control, approvals, provenance and configuration lineage management.
rationale: Anchors trust and accountability across the Codexa ecosystem.

title: Documentation
summary: Human-readable knowledge artifacts generated or maintained by Codexa.
rationale: Keeps all deliverables transparent and reviewable for stakeholders.

title: Discovery
summary: Automated source inspection, manifest generation, and system-model synthesis.
rationale: Forms the analytical core for Codexa’s understanding and blast-radius analysis.

title: Metrics & Maturity
summary: Understanding coverage, readiness, and process-maturity instrumentation.
rationale: Quantifies progress and confidence for every change and milestone.

title: Project Manager agent coordination
summary: Define and implement the PM agent orchestration logic coordinating Designer, Implementer and Tester agents.
rationale: Ensures deterministic multi-agent sequencing and auditability.

title: Status documentation currency
summary: Maintain up-to-date project overview and status documentation automatically from discovery outputs.
rationale: Provides continuous human visibility into system state and change lineage.

title: Structured handoff logging
summary: Extend audit logging primitives to record agent hand-offs, configuration provenance and maturity data.
rationale: Provides a verifiable trail of every automated or human transition.

title: Concern lifecycle automation
summary: Provide APIs and schema docs to log, mirror, and resolve concerns raised during execution.
rationale: Allows traceable resolution of issues within governance loops.

title: Discord bridge commands
summary: Implement `/status`, `/clarify`, and extended interaction commands bridging human control surfaces.
rationale: Enables transparent human oversight and AI responsiveness.

title: Command audit trail
summary: Record every command event and response for traceability and replay.
rationale: Supports auditability and test reproducibility.

title: Approval governance
summary: Capture, enforce and audit human approval gates across all change flows.
rationale: Ensures explicit human control at defined governance boundaries.

title: Discovery pipeline artifacts
summary: Implement the Codexa discovery pipeline producing manifests, metrics and blast-radius logs.
rationale: Provides a reproducible foundation for system-model understanding and later governance analysis.

title: System Model Graph (YAML projections)
summary: Generate and maintain canonical YAML projections of the System Model Graph from discovery outputs.
rationale: Ensures a persistent, repo-tracked representation of structural relationships for AI reasoning and governance.

title: Loop plan → seed packaging
summary: Implement `codexa loop plan` and `codexa seed --from loop-plan` commands that capture scope and produce runnable seed bundles.
rationale: Bridges discovery and change execution by bundling contextual artifacts and review digests.

title: Understanding coverage & readiness metrics
summary: Expose understanding coverage, readiness heatmaps and change stability ratios within `/status` and governance summaries.
rationale: Quantifies system comprehension and readiness for each milestone or change.

title: .codexa/ scaffolding lint
summary: Define the linting and validation logic that enforces `.codexa/` scaffolding contracts and migration helpers.
rationale: Guarantees consistent project scaffolding and configuration hygiene across deployments.

title: Global control-plane bundle
summary: Publish a versioned global configuration bundle under `~/.config/codexa/` and record provenance.
rationale: Centralises defaults and enables cross-project consistency through inherited settings.

title: Configuration discovery validation
summary: Implement `codexa doctor config` to verify precedence across project/global/hybrid configurations with telemetry reporting.
rationale: Validates configuration lineage and prevents drift between local and global defaults.

title: QA policy enforcement engine
summary: Implement QA policy parser and enforcement engine that validates maturity gates before merges.
rationale: Ensures quality policies are machine-enforced and test coverage thresholds maintained.

title: Status snapshots & observability metrics
summary: Provide `/status` snapshot generation with change-density, lag, drift and stability metrics.
rationale: Allows stakeholders to view objective progress and stability indicators per milestone.

title: Requirements Analyst agent
summary: Automate conversational intake and curation of requirements linked to discovery artifacts.
rationale: Streamlines requirement gathering and maintains bidirectional traceability.

title: Impact Assessor agent
summary: Generate readiness heatmaps and impact scoring with conversational follow-ups.
rationale: Provides objective prioritisation for change and testing focus.

title: QA Auditor agent
summary: Generate traceability-gap reports with risk tiers for unresolved requirements.
rationale: Highlights missing evidence or failing QA gates before milestone close.

title: Test Synthesizer agent
summary: Auto-generate test cases from impact-assessment results to expand coverage.
rationale: Automates regression test authoring for every new requirement.

title: Test Quality Assessor
summary: Calculate test-depth and risk coverage metrics, surfacing QA maturity ratios.
rationale: Measures effectiveness of generated and manual tests.

title: RACI metadata propagation
summary: Embed RACI roles in audit logs and artefact for accountability.
rationale: Clarifies who is Responsible, Accountable, Consulted or Informed for each change.

title: Bidirectional change traceability
summary: Link every change, requirement and test through shared metadata and hashes.
rationale: Provides full lifecycle traceability for audit and AI reasoning.

title: Project metadata source
summary: Capture project maturity, review history and criteria in `.codexa/project_metadata.yaml`.
rationale: Centralize maturity and governance data with human-readable mirrors.

title: Process maturity guide
summary: Publish human guide explaining maturity levels and agent participation expectations.
rationale: Gives teams consistent criteria for level advancement.

title: Maturity gate reviews
summary: Record and audit outcomes of maturity-level upgrades as change entries.
rationale: Ensures objective progression and documented review outcomes.

title: Maturity-aware agent prompts
summary: Adapt prompts for PM, GO, CE, IM, QA/TQA agents based on maturity level.
rationale: Aligns AI behaviour and expectations with organisation maturity.

title: Maturity metrics tracking
summary: Track time-in-level, upgrade counts and active criteria over time.
rationale: Provides longitudinal maturity analytics for governance reports.

title: Requirement elaboration workflow
summary: Support iterative elaboration of requirements with embedded discovery evidence before loop planning continues.
rationale: Improves clarity and verification of evolving requirements.

title: Implementer branch + artifact discipline
summary: Define Implementer micro-loop enforcing branch policy, artifact retention and deterministic builds.
rationale: Guarantees reproducible implementation runs that respect governance expectations.

title: Tester-owned QA artifacts (risk depth)
summary: Establish Tester/TQA-owned QA artifacts capturing risk depth and coverage ratios.
rationale: Ensures testing accountability and consistent measurement of QA quality.

title: GitOps workflow controls
summary: Integrate GitOps style pipeline triggers and rollbacks for declarative change control.
rationale: Provides automated, auditable deployment and rollback path.

title: Pause / resume & rollback controls
summary: Implement CLI and audit logging for pausing, resuming and rolling back automated workflows.
rationale: Enables safe interruption and recovery of long-running orchestration loops.

title: Implementer run retention policy
summary: Purge successful implementer runs after 48 h / 2 GB while respecting `.retain` markers.
rationale: Prevents disk bloat and enforces governance on storage use.

title: `/df.*` analysis commands
summary: Implement `/df.clarify`, `/df.analyze`, `/df.checklist` and `codexa doctor` CLI commands emitting structured JSON logs.
rationale: Standardises AI-driven diagnostics and impact analyses for governance ingestion.

title: SpekKit-inspired micro-task loop
summary: Re-implement SpekKit micro-task loop for planner/executor/cleanup stages without code reuse.
rationale: Provides lightweight deterministic task orchestration for implementer agents.

title: Change velocity dashboard
summary: Expose weekly/milestone velocity metrics via CLI and dashboard views.
rationale: Visualises delivery throughput and identifies bottlenecks.

title: Partial change approvals
summary: Support sub-decision approvals within change records to allow incremental merges.
rationale: Improves agility and accountability in multi-part changes.
